header.title: Trans woman woke up on male ward after undergoing knee surgery
header.postText: LGBT+ women face ‘blatant discrimination’ and a ‘surprising level of ignorance’ when accessing healthcare in the UK, a new study has shown.', 'A review published in the International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health found they face negative responses when coming out and are met with barriers when raising complaints.', 'The research was led by Professor Catherine Meads of Anglia Ruskin University (ARU), who examined the experiences of sexual minority women between 2010 and 2018 by analysing numerous studies in different health areas.', 'One contributor said: ‘They (the receptionist) refused to put down my partner’s name and partner/next of kin, kept saying ‘I’ll just put friend’, I said, no, I want you to put partner and she looked at me all lips pursed and said, ‘I’ll just put friend’.’', 'One woman, who accompanied her partner who was receiving treatment, said: ‘The locum first ignored my introduction as ‘partner’ and continued to call me ‘friend’ for the rest of the session.’', 'The study also highlighted a surprising level of ignorance among healthcare staff.', 'Another person quoted in the study said: ‘I was scheduled for a small bit of surgery and was asked to give a pregnancy test. I pointed out that I was not only a gay woman but also post-op male-to-female trans. The reply was ‘Well, best to be sure’.’', 'Another person said: ‘I was scheduled for a small bit of surgery and was asked to give a pregnancy test. I pointed out that I was not only a gay woman but also post-op male-to-female trans. The reply was ‘Well, best to be sure’.', 'The review was the first of its kind and drew on 26 different studies.', 'Professor Meads said her findings suggests a message of diversity is not filtering down to frontline staff.', 'She said: ‘Many healthcare staff do not feel they need to know about their patients’ sexuality. However, our research uncovered a worrying lack of knowledge of the issues, unfairness, negativity, and blatant discrimination.', '‘These studies found significant barriers to sexual minority women, highlighting the need for explicit and consistent education for healthcare professionals on the issues facing these women.’
header.socioLingVar: Gender - General,Nationality - Irish,Religious Identity - Roman Catholic,Age - Youngsters,Ethnicity - General

commentThread.commentText: Maybe give up the hospital bed for someone who really needs it instead of trying to make yourself a victim of something that’s not even news worthy! Just grow up and be thankful we even have a health care system that still provides a great service regardless of the fact that 99% of medical staff are hugely overworked and underpaid!

replies.commentText: Mick 'Sully' Hemming guess you can’t read too well so I’ll highlight. They needed an operation on the knee and were mistreated.  So no beds were taken from those who needed it more.I hope this helps 😂
Sophie-jayne Anderson sadly it seems that you can't read either, nowhere in the article does it say what actually happened, it looks like you simply read the title and didn't bother with the rest.
As sophie says, they were there for knee surgery. Do you think trans women shouldn't be allowed knee operations?
Sophie-jayne Anderson Mistreated. You should be a comedian. Looking at your profile you're halfway there.
Joanne Elwell I am a comedian but how do you explain yours? 😂

commentThread.commentText: Shameful. I thought this only happens in Muslim countries.

replies.commentText: I had the impression that in muslim countries they throw them off the highest roof they can find, not give them healthcare.
Luigi Ruggiero throw “them”??   Think you’ll find that’s Homosexuals,  Trans aren’t the same thing..What a hateful little man you are 😳
Luigi Ruggiero Nope. Iran actually offers to part pay for gender reasignment surgery for straight trans women. Not for the best of reasons, but still...

Sophie-jayne Anderson Why hateful? Would you have preferred that I had said its? Them indicates a group of people, and muslims do consider anybody that does not conform to their ideals of how it should be as deviant.

commentThread.commentText: Very confusing article, I couldn't find anything in the main text saying anything about the person having the knee surgery as per title. Was it's puropse just to see how many people would read the title and not the article itself/

replies.commentText: It's just a random collection of anecdotes from Professor Mead's research. This is science journalism from the metro. i wouldn't expect too much...

commentThread.commentText: thats the right thingHe is a man playing dress up. nothing more

replies.commentText: Medical science and the law both disagree, but i'm sure you know best...

commentThread.commentText: Hayley Forbes did you read my post? My point is everyone is entitled to healthcare in this country, but I will always be on the defensive when anyone has a go at any of the extremely hard working members of the NHS, no matter who you are, gender, race, beliefs, be glad you are able to get free healthcare!

replies.commentText: No one is "having a go" at anyone. this was a survey by  Anglia Ruskin University for transpeople to tell about their experiences with the NHS.They were asked to tell their stories and they did so. that's all

commentThread.commentText: Reading these comments it’s clear who has the right argument and who is resorting to just insulting people who have said something they may not like! SJA, grow up
